properties.name: Collier County - hot spot for refugee boats to avoid crackdown on smuggling in waters off Miami
properties.description: Posted by JennagCuban refugees land on Longboat Key\'s tip But U.S. Customs and Border Protection agents suggested that human smugglers are seeking out landing spots along the Gulf Coast to avoid a crackdown on smuggling in the waters off Miami. Collier County in particular has become a hot spot for refugee boats.

properties.name: November 13, 2006 - 17 Cubans found in Sanibel, Florida
properties.description: Posted by JennagMore Cubans smuggled in this morning Smugglers land 17 Cubans in Sanibel From The News Press SANIBEL - Though Coast Guard officials spotted a 33-foot long fast boat at sea, they were unable to intercept it before it beached, allowing 17 Cuban refugees to disembark. The group, a mixture of men, women and children, will be held in Broward County and can apply immediately to stay in America under the "wet foot/dry foot" pending criminal background checks. The two men suspected of piloting the fast boat are in custody today with the United States Border Patrol. Smugglers typically are paid 0,000 a head for running Cubans to Florida. The number of Cuban refugees smuggled into the United States has nearly doubled since 1996. Last year 6,356 Cuban refugees arrived here.
